p: Citronellal and citronellol found in the EO of C. citriodora may be responsible for both its antimicrobial activity and antioxidant activity [ 24, 26, 53, 54]. Elaissi et al. [ 52] reported inhibition zone values ranging from 10.0 ± 0.0 mm to 7.7 ± 0.6 mm against E. coli ATCC 25922 and S. aureus ATCC 25932, respectively, using absorbent disks impregnated with 10 μL of C. citriodora oil.
